Commit message:
Add new error message for customized partition check host connection error

To do this, we can [install rvm](http://rvm.io/rvm/basics) the Ruby version manager, and then:

```bash
rvm get stable --auto-dotfiles
```

to install and use the latest stable Ruby version for our operating system. Once we have Ruby installed, we can install the sass compiler:

```bash
gem install sass
```

Let's list all the `.scss` sass files currently in `helix-front`:

```bash
find . -name "*.scss"

./client/app/cluster/cluster-detail/cluster-detail.component.scss
./client/app/cluster/cluster.component.scss
./client/app/cluster/cluster-list/cluster-list.component.scss
./client/app/configuration/config-detail/config-detail.component.scss
./client/app/chooser/helix-list/helix-list.component.scss
./client/app/app.component.scss
./client/app/shared/input-inline/input-inline.component.scss
./client/app/shared/state-label/state-label.component.scss
./client/app/shared/node-viewer/node-viewer.component.scss
./client/app/shared/dialog/input-dialog/input-dialog.component.scss
./client/app/shared/dialog/alert-dialog/alert-dialog.component.scss
./client/app/shared/dialog/confirm-dialog/confirm-dialog.component.scss
./client/app/shared/key-value-pairs/key-value-pairs.component.scss
./client/app/shared/json-viewer/json-viewer.component.scss
./client/app/shared/disabled-label/disabled-label.component.scss
./client/app/shared/detail-header/detail-header.component.scss
./client/app/shared/data-table/data-table.component.scss
./client/app/controller/controller-detail/controller-detail.component.scss
./client/app/dashboard/dashboard.component.scss
./client/app/workflow/workflow-list/workflow-list.component.scss
./client/app/workflow/workflow-dag/workflow-dag.component.scss
./client/app/workflow/workflow-detail/workflow-detail.component.scss
./client/app/workflow/job-detail/job-detail.component.scss
./client/app/workflow/job-list/job-list.component.scss
./client/app/history/history-list/history-list.component.scss
./client/app/instance/instance-list/instance-list.component.scss
./client/app/instance/instance-detail/instance-detail.component.scss
./client/app/resource/resource-detail-for-instance/resource-detail-for-instance.component.scss
./client/app/resource/resource-node-viewer/resource-node-viewer.component.scss
./client/app/resource/resource-detail/resource-detail.component.scss
./client/app/resource/partition-list/partition-list.component.scss
./client/app/resource/partition-detail/partition-detail.component.scss
./client/app/resource/resource-list/resource-list.component.scss
./client/styles.scss
./client/theme.scss
```

alas, it looks like Ruby sass is deprecated, and now we have Dart sass. https://sass-lang.com/install

Let's try to install Dart sass with:

```bash
brew install sass/sass/sass
```

I ran a script to convert the sass files, but then realized that the sass files import styles from angular itself, which wasn't installed in `node_modules` yet. In order to do that, I had to:

```bash
# use a python 2.7 env so that node-sass would compile
# this is the kind of dev friction we are trying to get away from
source activate py27

# helix-front currently expects this version of nodejs
volta pin node@6

# finally install packages
npm install
```

the dart sass cli tool still can't find the stylesheet to import. That's odd.

```
  client/app/shared/state-label/state-label.component.scss 1:9  root stylesheet
Error: Can't find stylesheet to import.
  
1  @import '~@angular/material/theming';
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
```

Here's the [full log as a gist](https://gist.github.com/micahstubbs/208c7a6c484ba6b4c184b4ec165edf21).  Maybe these are just warnings that we can resolve manually?

Here is the shell script that I used to convert the `scss` files to `css`: 

```sh
#!/bin/sh
find . -print0 | while IFS= read -r -d '' file
do 
    EXT="${file##*.}"
    # # echo $EXT
    if [[ "${EXT}" == "scss" ]] 
    then
      BASENAME="${file##*/}"
      BASENAME=${BASENAME%".$EXT"}
      IN_PATH=$file
      OUT_PATH=${file%"$EXT"}
      OUT_PATH="${OUT_PATH}css"
      # echo "$file"
      # echo "$BASENAME"
      # echo "$IN_PATH"
      # echo "$OUT_PATH"
      # echo $PWD
      sass $IN_PATH $OUT_PATH
    fi
done
```

Now we can remove the `scss` files: 

```bash
git ls-files | grep '\.scss$' | xargs git rm
```

But for generic Apache Helix, it seemed to be more customized.
It seemed to be pure copy of the code? Is this possible we have historical commits ported from the branch?

Commit message:
Currently when instantiating a zk helix manager, we retrieve cloud config from zk and replace entire HelixCloudProperty object, which may cause some fields that user pass in in HelixCloudProperty that are not included in cloud config get missing. This commit changes the logic to only populate fields in HelixCloudProperty with values that are present in cloud config, and leave other fields unchanged.

Commit message:
Due to logical change in ZKHelixManager constructor in a https://github.com/apache/helix/pull/1986, TestCloudEventCallbackProperty broke because in this test it doesn't connect to zookeeper server.
To fix this test, we separated MockCloudEventAwareHelixManager previously called MockEventAwareZKHelixManager, nested inside TestCloudEventCallbackPropertyinto a class, and include all and only the logics related to cloud events in MockCloudEventAwareHelixManager. More detailed, we mock a cloud config object retrieved from zk to bypass connection to zk.

This PR is ready to be merged. Approved by @xyuanlu , thanks!

Commit message:
Merge helix-vm-freeze feature branch to master branch, change includes #1976, #1978, #2017, and #1995.

Great work! One suggestion: when this gets merged into master, we will not be squashing the commits to preserve them. As such, you might want to squash all of your own commits on top of the previous author's commit so that it's just one single commit that makes it mergeable back into master.

Hi @hmhagberg - thank you for the question. The historical context is this: IdealState is the de-facto definition for a resource with its required fields, but applications wanted to add more application-specific configs. But the original intention was to make IdealStates immutable (not enforced, unfortunately), so Helix added support for ResourceConfig. This is why things can work without ResourceConfig, but the intention is for a given resource to have a ResourceConfig and an IdealState pair.

But the log message seems to be coming from ConfigAccessor, which is entirely used by the application logic. Are you trying to ConfigAccessor#get? This, I don't believe, is being called by the Helix controller pipeline.
